Company Name
City ,
State
Technical and process expert on all web-based marketing systems resolved complex business issues, ad-hoc reporting, and analysis for all departments, such as design, operations, product managers, sourcing, warehouse and international markets consisting of over 700 employees.
Pivotal in the product creation lifecycle to ensure product was retailed to markets on time.
Implemented competitive advantages through quick and easy to use tools and training guides for product creation, e-commerce site management, product lifecycle management (PTC Flex PLM), digital merchandising, asset management and range segmentation application.
Worked with off shore team to implement these changes.

Distinguished user requests from the underlying true needs and provided options and recommendations on how best implement solutions to drive results.

Collaborated with the Regional Store Replenishment Managers to reduce ordering lead times to achieve the target goals by providing store specific ordering data.
Responsible for analyzing business issues that span across the entire supply chain.
Drive impactful decisions through modeling, optimization, varying complexities, benchmarking and vendor score cards.
Improved operational effectiveness and efficiency by driving Speed-To-Market components into the seasonal marketing process framework to reduce warehouse capacity and product liquidations of product.
Followed change management procedures compliance guidelines (SDLM) which includes gathering user requirements, gap and risk analysis, systems landscape as-is and to-be work streams, write and review functional/technical specifications, create and execute system integration (SIT) and user acceptance test scripts (UAT), stress testing, process flowcharts, developed SQL reporting queries, develop training documentation, release notes, cutover/deployment go live activities, IT service ticket management, conduct training sessions.

Forecasted weekly and total program sales by catalog using historical data.
Analyzed click through rates, bounce tracking, abandon rates, and event driven emails to understand user Internet behavior.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Vice President, Systems Architect

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
We are a Growing Retail Company Looking for a Vice President, IT Systems Architect!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Billy Marchant

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $190,000 - $215,000 per year

A bit about us:

Quality is the cornerstone of our brand. We meticulously source the finest materials and collaborate with master artisans who share our dedication to perfection. Every creation is a masterpiece, crafted to stand the test of time and transcend fleeting trends.

Why join us?

We believe in empowering our team members to reach their full potential. Joining this strategic project isn't just a step in your career; it's an accelerator. You'll be immersed in a dynamic environment where challenges become opportunities, and your skills are honed through hands-on experience. This is your chance to take your career to the next level.

Job Details

The Vice President, Systems Architect will report to the Chief Information Officer and is responsible for the development and implementation of the overall Technology, Systems, and Architecture strategy. The role involves collaborating with senior leaders to drive innovation, enhance business capabilities, and ensure alignment with the company's growth objectives.

Responsibilities:

 Collaborate with senior leadership to develop and execute technology, systems, and architecture strategy. Drive innovation and technological advancement to enhance business capabilities and drive competitive advantage. Provide thought leadership on emerging technologies and industry trends. Define and maintain enterprise architecture framework aligned with business objectives. Establish and enforce standards for architecture design, systems integration, and data management. Lead evaluation, selection, and implementation of technology solutions and platforms. Work with various departments to align technology initiatives with business priorities. Foster collaboration and communication between IT and other functional areas. Build and lead a high-performing IT and architecture team. Develop talent pipelines and succession plans. Provide mentorship and coaching to team members. Manage relationships with technology vendors, service providers, and strategic partners. Evaluate new technology vendors and partnerships. Collaborate with procurement and legal teams for compliance. Develop and manage the IT and architecture budget. Monitor IT spending and performance metrics. Provide transparent financial stewardship. Lead change management initiatives for technology adoption. Champion a culture of innovation and continuous improvement. Foster strong relationships with business stakeholders.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 10 years of experience in IT leadership roles, with a focus on systems architecture and technology strategy. Proven track record of successfully leading large-scale technology projects and initiatives. Strong understanding of enterprise architecture principles, systems integration, and data management. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Ability to collaborate effectively with senior leaders and cross-functional teams. Experience in vendor management, contract negotiation, and budget management. Knowledge of industry trends and emerging technologies. Certifications such as TOGAF, CISSP, or PMP are a plus.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
